wikipedia_page.main: William Keenan (1889 – 15 December 1955) was a British trade unionist and politician.Born in Bootle, Keenan became an official of the Transport and General Workers' Union in 1923.  He also joined the Labour Party, and was elected to Bootle Town Council in 1925, serving until 1945, including a term as Mayor of Bootle in 1944. He was Labour Member of Parliament (MP) for  Liverpool Kirkdale from 1945 to 1955.
